data.title: 10 Churches In Kanyakumari That Add Calmness To Your Trip
data.meta_description: Call God's faith miraculous, and call you will after visiting these churches in Kanyakumari. The list includes Our St. Catherine Church and the Imperial Church.
data.text:
Kanyakumari is famous for being the southernmost point of India. It is a well-known tourist destination. This place has an extension of natural resources and carries great historical and religious magnitude. The gravity of ancient sites and religious places pulls

devotees and history lovers towards the place. Consequently, it will be a perfect statement to define Kanyakumari as a top priority among travellers and tourists, for the religious as well as natural attractions.

So, here we are, discussing a specific religious site, the churches in Kanyakumari that have attracted tourists due to their peaceful and calm appeal. Here they are!

10 Churches In Kanyakumari

Here is a list of top churches in Kanyakumari that will give you the required amount of peace in your Kanyakumari trip. We suggest going to any of these for a couple hours, max, to get the dose of satisfaction:

The All Saints Church

Imperial Church

St. Xavier’s Cathedral

St. Catherine Church

St.Thasnavis Matha Church

Our Woman of Ransom Church

Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church

Our Lady of Fatima Church

Church of Our Lady of Lourdes

St. Anthony Church

1. The All Saints Church

Image Source

The All Saints Church is the most distinguishable church in Muttom. It has almost 800 devotees and, in addition, a publicly praised traveler landing place. This congregation is placed on the extremely beautiful shores of the blue waters of the Bay of Bengal. The conclave here is arranged perfectly, joined by water and street. It is a catholic church and has innate Portuguese principle amid the period 1875-1914. The brilliant beauty of Portuguese structural strategy is evidently seen in the extravagant front and simple yet wonderful insides.

Address: Muttom, Church Road, Mutton, Tamil Nadu- 629202

Opening Hours: 10 am – 5 pm

Must Read: 5 Quixotic Homestays In Kanyakumari To Revamp Your Idea Of Lodging

2. Imperial Church

Image Source

Situated in Thiruvithamcode and sometimes known by names like Thomaiyar Kovil or St Mary’s Orthodox Church. It is generally believed that it was shaped by St. Thomas, known as the Apostle of India, one of the twelve sacred missionaries of the Lord Jesus Christ. The congregation took its shape in the seventeenth century and divided into three sections at that time. Further progress was made in the twentieth century. A passageway corridor was developed. Its dividers are assembled of stone quarried locally, and embossed by gifted specialists a multi-tipped hand driven etches.

Address: 133A, SH 180, Thiruvithamcode, Tamil Nadu- 629174

Opening Hours: 5 am – 9 pm

Suggested Read: Top 12 Interesting Things to Do in Kanyakumari For A Vacation To Remember

3. St. Xavier’s Cathedral

Image Source

St. Francis Xavier’s Cathedral is one of the most famous churches in Kanyakumari, located in Kottar. Kottar is the second indispensable place after Goa, where individuals from varying backgrounds, dialect and religion were united by faith and regarded St. Xavier. It is one of the most acknowledged places of worship in Tamil Nadu.

Address: Mortar, Kanyakumari, Nagercoil, Tamil Nadu – 629002

Opening Hours: 9 am – 8 pm

Suggested Read: 10 Incredible Hill Stations Near Kanyakumari For A Refreshing Vacay In South India

4. St. Catherine Church

Image Source

St. Catherine Church lies on the coastal edge of Arabian Sea, in the village of Eraviputhenthurai, which falls under the Thoothoor Village Panchayat in the Vilavancode taluk inside the Kanyakumari District. The church plays an essential role in routine chores of the people of the village. St. Catherine Church is built under the Diocese of Cochin, and was constructed under the supervision of English Missionaries.

Address: Eraviputhenthurai, Thuthur (P.O), Thuthur, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu- 629176

Opening Hours: 9:30 am – 6:30 pm, closed on sundays

Suggested Read: Top 10 Hotels In Kanyakumari Shortlisted! Have A Look!

5. St.Thasnavis Matha Church

Image Source

The church is devoted to St.Thasnavis Matha (Our Lady of Snows) and established in the year of 1954 in The Maravankudieruppu Village that was constructed in 1781 by Thiru. Swamiyadian Thirupappu Nadar and his antecedents. It is one of the best churches in Kanyakumari to have a peaceful time.

Address: Maravankudieruppu Nagercoil, Nagercoil Town, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu- 629002

Opening Hours: 6 am – 5:30 pm, closed on Wednesdays

Suggested Read: 7 Best Resorts In Kanyakumari For A Memorable And Beautiful Vacation

6. Our Woman of Ransom Church

Image Source

The Shrine of Our Lady of Ransom welcomes the visitors with three sky-scraping towers that seem to stand sturdily in the bright sun and transmit their gleaming white. The peace and beauty is well defined by the shores nearby, where the pontoons and ships are fastened secured. The congregation invites every one of the individuals with their satisfying sight who come here to pray earnestly or to appreciate the glory of the building design.

Address: Church Road, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu – 629702

Opening Hours: 5:30 am – 7 pm

Suggested Read: 5 Beautiful Temples In Kanyakumari You Must Visit On Your Trip

7. Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church

Image Source

The church has its presence in the Ramapuram Village in the Kanyakumari District, and it has a 150 year old history. The community of Nanjil Nattu Vellalar Pillai was orthodox but several families belonging to elite high-class Hindu sect took to conversion and they became Roman catholic. Hence, this church came into existence to cater to these people.

Address: Ramapuram, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu- 629303

Opening Hours: 6:30 am – 6:30 pm

Suggested Read: Top 23 Tourist Places In Kanyakumari: The Land Where The Oceans Meet

8. Our Lady of Fatima Church

Image Source

The church is popular as Kallukoottam R.C. Church and is visited by the Catholic Christians. The church gives opportunity to the children to live up to the Catholic faith. There are also Eucharistic celebrations during the times of Christmas. The towers of this church in Kanyakumari excels the artsman prowess of mechanization to express the flourishing of architecture.

Address: Kandee Vilagam, Kallukoottam, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu- 629802

Opening Hours: 9 am – 5pm

Suggested Read: 12 Places Near Kanyakumari For The Perfect Weekend Getaway

9. Church of Our Lady of Lourdes

Image Source

The church is basically for the Catholics, and is popular for organizing the Sunday Mass, Marriage Mass, as well as the Sacrament of Ceremony, besides other types of liturgical ceremonies. The towers of the church signify the exemplary time span of the history of architecture of the parish. The sculptural gracefulness of the statues of Saints, Christ and the holy relics are the expansive prowess of hard work of many craftsmen.

Address: Rajakkamangalam Road, Punnai Nagar, Tamil Nadu- 629004

Opening Hours: 6 am- 6 pm

Further Read: 25 Inviting Tourist Places In Kottayam That You Cannot Miss

10. St. Anthony Church

Image Source

The church is visited by Christians of Roman Catholic faith. It used to be under the control of the Roman Catholic Parish of Kuzhithurai Diocese. There is a special mass done every Tuesday and Friday. You can be a part of it or you can admire the surroundings which have a sort of western appeal to it with a hint of freshness in the air. It is truly a great place to spend a few hours.

Address: Kurusady, Nagercoil, Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu- 629002

Opening Hours: 6 am – 5 pm

Further Read: 10 Places To Visit In Ooty In May That Are Exquisite, Breathtaking, And Adventurous!

The Dravidian, Gothic and European skills are sculptured through these holy structures. So, have you decided to plan a trip to Kanyakumari and visit any of these religious sites? Why won’t you? Afterall, you are visiting Kanyakumari to have a complete vacation and so you will after visiting the churches. So, get ready and customize your tour and while enjoying, do take time out to write two lines in the comments section. Have a nice trip!

Frequently Asked Questions about Churches in Kanyakumari

What is the ideal time to visit Kanyakumari?

February to October is the optimum time to visit Kanyakumari. The reason is that the weather during this time of the year is quite calm and enjoyable.

Which is the most popular church in Kanyakumari?

St. Antony Church, Pozhikarai, Kanyakumari District is regarded as the most popular church and is known for its sophisticated architecture. The church has a unique flamboyance and is considered as the rich place of worship among the Catholics.

What makes the Our Woman of Ransom Churches in Kanyakumari famous?

The front is built in an astounding Gothic style and its richness is extensively distinctive to be exposed from insides. The inside is enhanced with the quiet and tranquil environment where ingrained an excellent icon of Mother Mary and cross on the holy place.

Is it possible to cover all churches in one day?

Kanyakumari is known for churches as much as it is popular among the travellers for its temples. If you are interested in the church tour, you need to spend at least two to three days before you complete watching the churches in Kanyakumari.
